alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 13 at 5:42AM MST until December 13 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...PLAINS BLIZZARD TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT... .A strong winter storm system will produce blizzard conditions over northeastern Colorado today through tonight. Strong winds are expected to gust up to 60 mph. The heaviest snow is expected to be on the plains east of Greeley and Denver, focusing toward the Akron, Sterling, Fort Morgan and Limon areas. If you are planning travel northeast, east or southeast of Denver today, you should consider changing your plans to avoid travel. Travel will be difficult to impossible and road closures are likely. Those with outdoor livestock interests should prepare now for blizzard conditions. Continued cold and very windy weather will continue behind the storm Wednesday into Thursday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Southern Lincoln County. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST this morning. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
